access.description: The registered URL returns a static HTML page (8,964 bytes) with no JavaScript SPA or anti-bot protection. The page describes two EHI Export configurations and links to two detailed specification pages (Config 1 and Config 2) plus three PDF data dictionaries. All content is accessible via plain curl with a User-Agent header. A link to customer.meditech.com requires SAML authentication but the main public docs are complete without it.

products.name: MEDITECH Expanse

product_context.description: MEDITECH Expanse is MEDITECH's flagship modern EHR platform marketed as the 'Intelligent EHR.' It is a comprehensive health information system used by hundreds of hospitals and thousands of ambulatory care sites. The product includes full acute and ambulatory EHR with physician and nursing documentation, Revenue Cycle Management (ranked #1 in 2025 KLAS for Patient Accounting: Small), Patient Connect (patient engagement with secure messaging/texting), MyHealth patient portal (separately certified as CHPL 10988), scheduling, Emergency Department Management, Oncology, Pharmacy, Lab, Radiology, Pathology, Surgical Services, Population Health, Surveillance, Analytics, and interoperability via Traverse Exchange.

export_approach.description: Expanse uses Configuration 1: a hybrid approach combining Electronic Chart documents (scanned/archived HIM documents in image/PDF formats organized by category/subcategory), a US Core FHIR R4 JSON bundle (US Core STU 3.1.1 via Patient $everything), all previously-created C-CDA documents (R2.1 or R1.1), and supplemental text/PDF reports for financial, authorization/referral, ambulatory results, immunization, population health, utilization review, and historical ambulatory data. The export is packaged as a ZIP with an NDJSON manifest using FHIR DocumentReference resources. This is NOT a native database dump — it's a curated export of documents and reports plus FHIR resources. The modern platform paradoxically has a less structured export than the legacy platforms.

documentation_quality.description: Configuration 1 documentation is provided as inline HTML on the spec page (29,280 bytes). Unlike Config 2 which has detailed CSV table/column PDFs, Config 1 has no downloadable data dictionary. The export is document-based and FHIR-based, so individual field documentation doesn't apply the same way, but the lack of specificity about exactly which FHIR resources are included is a gap. The HTML describes sections and file types but not field-level schemas.

ehi_coverage.overall_assessment: Clinical data is present via FHIR bundle and C-CDA documents, plus Electronic Chart scanned documents. However, the export relies heavily on FHIR US Core constraints and document images rather than structured database tables. Financial data comes as text reports rather than structured tables. Insurance/authorization data is exported as PDF reports, not machine-readable. Portal messages appear absent despite MEDITECH having both MyHealth portal and Patient Connect with secure messaging. No audit trails. The modern Expanse platform has a notably less structured export than the legacy C/S and MAGIC platforms.

clinical.evidence: US Core FHIR bundle includes conditions, medications, allergies, labs, vitals, procedures, encounters, immunizations, care plans. C-CDA documents provide additional clinical summaries. Electronic Chart section contains scanned/archived clinical documents. Supplemental reports cover ambulatory results, immunization history, population health, utilization review.

secure_messages.evidence: No dedicated messages section in the Config 1 export. The main page notes Configuration 1 is 'configured for use with Patient and Consumer Health Portal (PHM) *Not Required.' The FHIR bundle does not include portal messages as a standard US Core resource. This is a significant gap given MEDITECH has both MyHealth patient portal (separately certified) and Patient Connect with secure messaging/texting capabilities.

billing_financial.evidence: FinancialEHI.txt contains patient accounting financial transactions, ResidentTrustEHI.txt for resident trust data, CostEstimation.txt for cost estimates. However, these are text reports — likely rendered printouts rather than structured database tables. Compare to Config 2's detailed CSV tables (PbrAccountClaims, PbrAccountTransactions, PbrAccountTxnPymntDistribution). Expanse financial data appears less granular and less machine-readable.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Authorization & Referral Management Reports include ARMEHI-InsEligCopayDeductData.pdf (insurance eligibility, copay, deductible data) and ARMEHI-ArmAuthData.pdf (authorizations and referrals). These are PDF reports rather than structured data. Insurance demographics may appear in the FHIR bundle Coverage resource if supported.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: FHIR Encounter resources present in the bundle. However, there is no dedicated scheduling export with appointment-specific fields (status, type, booking details) comparable to the SchAppointments table in Config 2's CSV exports.

documents_images.evidence: Strong coverage. The Electronic Chart section is the centerpiece of Config 1, containing all scanned/archived documents organized by account, category, and subcategory. File formats include images (png, jpg, tif, bmp) and PDFs. Also includes historical ambulatory data (migrated documents).

audit_trails.evidence: No audit section in the export. No audit tables or access logs documented.

issues: No downloadable data dictionary for Config 1 — unlike Config 2 which has detailed CSV table/column PDFs.
Financial data exported as text reports (FinancialEHI.txt), not structured CSV/JSON — limits machine readability.
Insurance and authorization data exported as PDF reports — not machine-readable structured data.
Portal messages likely missing despite MEDITECH MyHealth portal and Patient Connect both supporting messaging.
Patient portal integration marked 'Not Required' in Configuration 1 — portal-related data may be absent if not configured.
Modern Expanse platform paradoxically has less structured export than legacy C/S and MAGIC platforms.
products.summary: MEDITECH Expanse uses a hybrid export (Configuration 1) combining document images, FHIR R4 bundle, C-CDA, and supplemental text/PDF reports. Clinical coverage is adequate through FHIR and documents, but financial and insurance data come as text/PDF reports rather than structured tables. Secure messages appear absent despite the product's portal and messaging capabilities. The modern platform ironically has a less machine-readable export than MEDITECH's legacy platforms.

products.name: MEDITECH 6.x
certified_module_names: MEDITECH 6.1 Electronic Health Record Core HCIS
MEDITECH 6.0 Electronic Health Record Core HCIS

product_context.description: MEDITECH 6.x represents the prior generation of MEDITECH's EHR platform, with 6.08 and 6.15 being specific versions. Like Expanse, these are comprehensive hospital information systems with clinical, financial, and administrative modules. MEDITECH 6.15 is the most feature-rich 6.x version with both acute and ambulatory capabilities, while 6.08 has split coverage. The platform includes revenue cycle, patient portal, scheduling, pharmacy, lab, radiology, and the same general module set as Expanse with older interfaces.

export_approach.description: MEDITECH 6.x uses a split approach across both configurations. 6.15 (Acute & Ambulatory) uses Configuration 1 — same hybrid approach as Expanse (Electronic Chart + FHIR + C-CDA + supplemental reports), excluding Population Health and Historical Ambulatory Data. 6.08 Acute uses a reduced Config 1 set (Electronic Chart, C-CDA, FHIR, Financial Reports, Immunization History, Ambulatory Order Summary, Patient Notices). 6.08 Ambulatory uses Configuration 2 — CSV-based export with structured patient data files plus FHIR + C-CDA + supplemental reports. The 6.08 Ambulatory CSV export documents ~384 unique field/table names.

documentation_quality.description: Documentation quality varies by version. 6.15 uses Config 1's inline HTML documentation (no downloadable data dictionary). 6.08 Ambulatory has a detailed PDF data dictionary (meditech-608-ehi-export-csv.pdf, 19 pages, 251 KB, dated October 2023) documenting ~384 unique field/table names with table and column definitions. The PDF covers CSV table structures including demographics, encounters, lab results, billing, pharmacy, scheduling, and insurance tables.

ehi_coverage.overall_assessment: Coverage varies significantly by version. 6.15 mirrors Expanse's Config 1 limitations (text/PDF reports for financial and insurance data, no explicit messages). 6.08 Ambulatory via Config 2 has substantially more structured data with CSV tables covering encounters, lab results, billing (PbrAccountClaims, PbrAccountTransactions), insurance (AdmInsuredData, MriPatientInsurances), scheduling (SchAppointments), pharmacy (RxmOrds, RxmRxs), and encounter messages (AprEncMessages). The 6.08 Ambulatory export is significantly more machine-readable than the 6.15 export.

clinical.evidence: For 6.15: same as Expanse Config 1 (FHIR bundle + C-CDA + Electronic Chart documents). For 6.08 Ambulatory: CSV tables include AprEnc encounters, AprRes lab results, AprResMic microbiology results, problems, family/social history, vitals, plus FHIR bundle and C-CDA.

secure_messages.evidence: For 6.08 Ambulatory (Config 2): AprEncMessages and AprEncMessagesLines tables in CSV contain encounter-level messages with MessageUserID field. These appear to be clinical encounter messages rather than patient portal messages. For 6.15 (Config 1): no explicit messages section, same gap as Expanse.

billing_financial.evidence: For 6.08 Ambulatory (Config 2): comprehensive billing tables — PbrAccountClaims, PbrAccountClaimsDetail (with ClaimNumber, TransactionUrn, amounts), PbrAccountTransactions, PbrAccountStatements, PbrAccountTxnPymntDistribution, PbrAccountInsurance, PbrAccountInsuranceCopayTypes. For 6.15 (Config 1): FinancialEHI.txt text report only, same limitation as Expanse.

insurance_coverage.evidence: For 6.08 Ambulatory: structured CSV tables including AdmInsuredData (TreatmentAuthorizationNumber, ElectronicCheck), MriPatientInsurances, ArmAuths (authorizations with InsuranceID, service units). For 6.15: PDF reports only (same as Expanse).

appointments_scheduling.evidence: For 6.08 Ambulatory: SchAppointments table with ApptDate, ApptTime, ApptStatus, AppointmentTypeID, AppointmentID. For 6.15: FHIR Encounter resources only.

documents_images.evidence: Electronic Chart documents in Config 1 (scanned/archived documents). Config 2 includes supplemental reports/images section covering external documents and scanned items.

audit_trails.evidence: No audit tables found in either configuration's documentation for 6.x.

issues: 6.08 Ambulatory CSV export has significantly more structured data than the Config 1 approach used by 6.15, creating inconsistent coverage across versions.
Financial data as structured CSV tables (6.08 Amb) vs text report (6.15) is a meaningful machine-readability difference within the same product line.
6.15 shares the same Config 1 limitations as Expanse: text/PDF financial reports, PDF insurance reports, no portal messages.
6.08 CSV data dictionary PDF dated October 2023 — notably old.
Encounter messages (AprEncMessages) may not include patient portal messages.
products.summary: MEDITECH 6.x coverage varies significantly by version. 6.15 mirrors Expanse's Config 1 limitations with document-based export. 6.08 Ambulatory uses Config 2 with structured CSV tables (~384 fields) covering billing, insurance, scheduling, and encounter messages — significantly more machine-readable. No audit trails in either version.

products.name: MEDITECH Client/Server
certified_module_names: MEDITECH Client/Server Electronic Health Record Core HCIS

product_context.description: MEDITECH Client/Server (v5.67) is an older generation platform preceding the 6.x line. Despite its age, many hospitals still run it. It supports both acute and ambulatory care with the same general module set as newer platforms: clinical documentation, revenue cycle, scheduling, pharmacy, lab, radiology, pathology, surgical services, blood bank, nursing, and order entry.

export_approach.description: Client/Server uses both configurations. C/S Acute-only uses Configuration 1 (Electronic Chart + FHIR + C-CDA + Financial Reports + Provider Messages + Implantable Devices + Immunizations). C/S Acute & Ambulatory uses Configuration 2 with the most comprehensive CSV export across all MEDITECH platforms — ~923 unique field/table identifiers covering admissions, ambulatory encounters, lab/micro/pathology, radiology, pharmacy (60+ tables), nursing, surgical, blood bank, orders, billing, auth/referral, problems, care teams, scheduling, and prescription management. Config 2 also includes provider/patient messages, external documents/images, scanned documents, and clinical reports.

documentation_quality.description: The CSV data dictionary PDF for Client/Server (meditech-cs-acute-amb-ehi-export-dr.pdf, 20 pages, 263 KB) documents ~923 unique field/table identifiers — the most comprehensive of the three platform PDFs. It covers table and column definitions across all major clinical, financial, and administrative domains. Dated October 2023.

ehi_coverage.overall_assessment: Client/Server Config 2 is the most complete export across all MEDITECH platforms, approaching a true database dump. It covers 60+ pharmacy tables, full lab/micro/pathology, radiology, nursing care plans, surgical case data, blood bank, comprehensive orders, structured billing, insurance, scheduling, provider messages, and extensive document/image support. The C/S Acute-only Config 1 export is much more limited. This is the gold standard within MEDITECH's export architecture.

clinical.evidence: Comprehensive structured CSV tables: 60+ pharmacy tables (PhaRx*), lab specimens and tests (LabSpecimens, LabSpecimenTests), microbiology (MicSpecimens, MicSpecimenOrganisms), pathology with images (PthSpecimens, PthSpecimenHistologies, PthSpecimenPictures), radiology (ItsOrder* imaging orders, exams, findings, impressions, radiation dose), nursing care plans (NurPatientPoc*, NurPatientSoc*, NurPlanOfCareTd*), surgical cases (SchOrPatCase* with complications, medications, vital signs, devices, implants), blood bank (BbkSpecimens, BbkUnits, BbkHistoryTransfusions), orders (OeOrders, OeOrderEdits), problems (HubPatientProblems*), care teams (MriPatientCareTeams, MriVisitCareTeams).

secure_messages.evidence: Both 'Provider Messages.pdf' in Config 2 (containing provider-to-provider and provider-to-patient messaging) and AprEncMessages/AprEncMessagesLines in CSV for encounter-level messages. However, provider messages are delivered as PDF rather than structured data. Patient portal (MyHealth) messages may not be fully represented.

billing_financial.evidence: Structured CSV tables: PbrAccountClaims, PbrAccountClaimsDetail (with amounts, claim numbers, transaction IDs), PbrAccountTransactions, PbrAccountStatements, PbrAccountTxnPymntDistribution, PbrAcctTxnDxs — comprehensive billing with payment distributions and diagnosis linkage.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Structured CSV tables: AdmInsurances (insurance ID, address, benefit plan, other name), AdmInsuredInfo, MriPatientInsurances, ArmAuths, ArmAuthServices, ArmAuthReferNoteHistories — covering insurance demographics, authorizations, referrals, and service details.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: SchAppointments table with date, time, status, type. Also extensive surgical scheduling via SchOrPatCase* tables covering OR cases.

documents_images.evidence: External documents/images section, point of contact scanned documents, clinical reports with physician documentation, radiology reports, pathology reports with images (PthSpecimenPictures), nursing image documentation (NurPlanOfCareTd*).

audit_trails.evidence: Minimal evidence. PhaRxAuditDetailText in pharmacy suggests some domain-specific audit tracking exists, but there is no general audit trail export or comprehensive access log.

issues: Provider Messages exported as PDF rather than structured data — limits machine readability.
C/S Acute-only Config 1 export is much more limited than the Config 2 Acute & Ambulatory export, creating inconsistent coverage by deployment type.
Data dictionary PDF dated October 2023.
Patient portal messages may not be fully represented despite messaging capabilities.
No comprehensive audit trail despite PhaRxAuditDetailText suggesting audit data exists in the system.
products.summary: MEDITECH Client/Server Config 2 is the most complete export across all MEDITECH platforms, with ~923 field/table identifiers approaching a true database dump. It covers 60+ pharmacy tables, full lab/pathology/radiology, nursing, surgical, blood bank, structured billing, insurance, scheduling, and provider messages. The main gaps are audit trails and the inconsistency between the comprehensive Config 2 and the limited Config 1 (Acute-only) export.

products.name: MEDITECH MAGIC
certified_module_names: MEDITECH MAGIC Electronic Health Record Core HCIS
MEDITECH MAGIC HCA Electronic Health Record Core HCIS (without PatientKeeper)

product_context.description: MEDITECH MAGIC (v5.67) is the oldest supported MEDITECH platform, with a character-based interface dating to the 1990s. Despite this, many hospitals continue to operate on MAGIC. It includes the same general module set as newer platforms: clinical, financial, and administrative modules. MAGIC HCA is a variant used at HCA Healthcare facilities (without PatientKeeper), separately certified as CHPL 11018.

export_approach.description: Similar split to Client/Server. MAGIC Acute-only uses Configuration 1 (Electronic Chart + FHIR + C-CDA + Financial Reports + Provider Messages + Implantable Devices, without Immunizations compared to C/S). MAGIC Acute & Ambulatory uses Configuration 2 with structured CSV patient data (~891 unique field/table identifiers) plus FHIR + C-CDA + clinical reports + provider/patient messages + financial reports + external documents + scanned documents. MAGIC has notably more table groups than C/S in some areas, particularly Emergency Department (Edm*), family history (Eps*), and radiology (RadExams* with 16+ tables).

documentation_quality.description: The MAGIC CSV data dictionary PDF (meditech-magic-ehi-export-dr.pdf, 20 pages, 363 KB) documents ~891 unique field/table identifiers. It is the largest PDF by file size among the three platform dictionaries, with particularly detailed coverage of Emergency Department, radiology, and ambulatory visit data. Dated October 2023. The oldest platform ironically has some of the most detailed CSV documentation.

ehi_coverage.overall_assessment: MAGIC Config 2 is highly comprehensive, similar in scope to Client/Server with additional ED-specific tables (Edm*), detailed family history (Eps*), and strong radiology coverage (RadExams* with 16+ tables). Messaging is present in multiple forms. Billing, insurance, and scheduling are all structurally covered with CSV tables. The main gap remains audit trails, though domain-specific audit tables exist (health maintenance audit, document signature history, pathology signout audits). The oldest platform has one of the most complete exports.

clinical.evidence: Comprehensive CSV tables with ED-specific data (EdmPatientDocuments, EdmPatientDocumentText, EdmPatientCallMngmnt, EdmPatientDepartRefers, EdmPatientNotes, EdmReminders), detailed family history (EpsFamilyHistory* with problems, relations, comments), problems (EpsProblems* with qualifiers, codes, descriptions, visits), radiology (RadExams* with 16+ tables covering exams, findings, mammography, staff, tech queries, film repeats, followups), ambulatory visits (PbrMpiVisVisits* with vitals, messages, problems, health maintenance), plus FHIR bundle and C-CDA.

secure_messages.evidence: Multiple message sources: PbrMpiVisVisitsMessagesText in CSV (visit-level messages with 'New Message' field), Provider Messages as text files (provider-to-provider and provider-to-patient messaging with embedded images), EdmPatientNoteText (ED notes). Provider Messages section explicitly includes 'Provider to Provider and Provider to Patient messaging.'

billing_financial.evidence: Structured CSV tables: PbrAccountClaims, PbrAccountClaimDetail, PbrAccountTransactions, PbrAccountStatements, PbrAccountTxnPymntDistribution, PbrAccountTransactionDiagnoses, PbrAccountDemographics, with fields including BilledAmt and BilledBadDebtAmt.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Structured CSV tables: AdmInsuranceOtherType, AdmInsuredData (PolicyNumber, GroupNumber, GroupName, TreatmentAuthorizationNumber, InsuranceElecCheck), MriPatientInsurances, ArmAuths, ArmAuthServices, ArmAuthInpatientDays.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: SchAppointments table plus extensive surgical scheduling (SchOrPatCase* tables).

documents_images.evidence: ED documents (EdmPatientDocuments, EdmPatientDocumentText), ambulatory documents with text and images, pathology images, radiology reports, external scanned documents.

audit_trails.evidence: Domain-specific audit tables exist: PbrMpiVisHlthMntItemsAudit (health maintenance audit), EdmPatientDocumentSigHistory (document signature history), PthSpecimenSignoutAuds (pathology signout audits). These are not comprehensive access logs but indicate some audit data is stored. No general audit trail export.

issues: MAGIC HCA variant (CHPL 11018) is separately certified — unclear if export differs from standard MAGIC.
PbrMpiVisVisitsMessagesText table name suggests visit messages but full scope of messaging data is unclear.
Data dictionary PDF dated October 2023.
Domain-specific audit tables exist but no comprehensive audit trail is exported.
Provider messages exported as text files rather than structured CSV data.
products.summary: MEDITECH MAGIC Config 2 is highly comprehensive with ~891 field/table identifiers, featuring notably strong ED, radiology, and family history coverage. Multiple messaging sources are included. Billing, insurance, and scheduling are structurally covered with CSV tables. The oldest MEDITECH platform ironically has one of the most complete and well-documented exports, though audit trails remain a gap.

downloaded_files.description: Main EHI Export landing page describing two export configurations and linking to detailed spec pages and PDF data dictionaries.
Configuration 1 detailed specification page for Expanse, 6.15, 6.08 Acute, C/S Acute, MAGIC Acute. Describes Electronic Chart + FHIR + C-CDA + supplemental reports export.
Configuration 2 detailed specification page for 6.08 Ambulatory, C/S, MAGIC. Describes CSV patient data + FHIR + C-CDA + supplemental reports export. Links to three PDF data dictionaries.
Client/Server Acute & Ambulatory EHI Export CSV table/column definitions. 20 pages, ~923 unique field/table identifiers. Dated October 2023.
MAGIC Acute & Ambulatory EHI Export CSV table/column definitions. 20 pages, ~891 unique field/table identifiers. Dated October 2023.
MPM 6.08 Ambulatory EHI Export CSV table/column definitions. 19 pages, ~384 unique field/table identifiers. Dated October 2023.

summary: MEDITECH documents EHI export across four platforms (Expanse, 6.x, Client/Server, MAGIC) using two fundamentally different configurations. Configuration 1 (Expanse, 6.15) uses a document-centric hybrid of scanned images, FHIR R4 bundle, C-CDA, and text/PDF supplemental reports — less structured and less machine-readable. Configuration 2 (C/S, MAGIC, 6.08 Ambulatory) uses structured CSV tables approaching a native database dump, with 384–923 field/table identifiers. The modern Expanse platform paradoxically has the least structured export, while the oldest platforms (C/S, MAGIC) have the most comprehensive coverage. Audit trails are absent across all platforms. Secure messages have varying coverage — absent in Expanse, present but limited in legacy platforms.
notes: The 'Regulatory EHI Export Functionality Guides' at customer.meditech.com require SAML authentication and are not publicly accessible. All three PDF data dictionaries are dated October 2023, which is notably old. The CHPL IDs list also includes 18 ancillary certifications (Cancer Case Reporting, Public Health Interfaces, Syndromic Surveillance, CCD Interfaces, Electronic Case Reporting) that are not EHR products and share the same export documentation URL. The CCD/Public Health interface modules do not have their own EHI export — they are part of the broader platform exports.
